title: Strengthening Clinical Competencies: Program-Based Instructional Design for Medical Education Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can analyze three types of evaluation tools used in medical settings (operating room, ward, emergency room) at the end of a one-week course and design drafts of new tools reflecting reliability, validity, and educational impact.
Strengthening the capacity to integrate multiple assessment data (qualitative and quantitative) and apply expert judgment processes

Learners can analyze three medical/nursing evaluation scenarios (e.g., post-surgery recovery assessment, chronic disease management evaluation, emergency response evaluation) and establish optimization strategies selecting two or more context-appropriate tools (checklists, observation records, patient surveys) with justified rationale (validity, reliability, feasibility).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
